description.p: You have been touched by primordial fire. Did you receive this power as a gift from a noble Efreeti, or were you born near a rift leading to the elemental plane of fire? This ember of primal flame within you may manifest in your outward appearance or through your emotions. Most Emberheart sorcerers revel in their exotic appearance; flame red hair, eyes like glowing embers, or dark skin with magma peering through cracks. Is your flaming soul a raging inferno, unable to be controlled, or, do you seek to master your power?

div.p: When using the Emberheart Origin presented here, consider pairing them with a genasi character for a true elemental experience!

description.p: You learn certain spells at the sorcerer levels noted in the Emberheart Magic table. They count as sorcerer spells for you, but don't count against your number of Spells Known.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a conjuration or evocation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

Beginning at 1st level, the ember of elemental flame within you fundamentally changes your physical being. You are resistant to fire damage and have advantage on saving throws to resist being charmed or frightened.
In addition, you can speak, read, and write Ignan. This allows you to communicate with creatures that speak Primordial and it's other dialects: Aquan, Auran, and Terran.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws to resist being charmed or frightened. You can communicate with creatures that speak Primordial and it's other dialects.

description.p: Your inner flame has begun to burn more intensely. Starting at 6th level, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals fire damage, you can use you reaction to spend 2 sorcery points and cause the creature to explode. Creatures within 10 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage based on the size of the slain creature. On a successful save they take no damage.
Small creatures deal 1d6 fire damage, and for each size category above Small, the explosion deals an additional 1d6 damage. Tiny or smaller creatures produce no explosion.

sheet.description: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals fire damage, you can cause the creature to explode. Creatures within 10 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage based on the size of the slain creature. On a successful save they take no damage. Small creatures deal 1d6 fire damage, and for each size category above Small, the explosion deals an additional 1d6 damage. Tiny or smaller creatures produce no explosion.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, your connection to the Elemental Plane of Fire allows your body to be restored by magical fire. When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals fire damage, you can choose to regain hit points equal to the level at which the spell was cast + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals fire damage, you can choose to regain hit points equal to the level at which the spell was cast + {{cha-mod:min-one}}.

description.p: You have mastered the elemental fire that burns within your soul, allowing you to become more elemental then mortal. Upon reaching 18th level, you no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep, and you are immune to fire damage.

In addition, when you take damage from a creature within 60 feet that you can see, you can use your reaction to spend 2 sorcery points and rebuke them with elemental flame. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw, and on a failed save they take fire damage equal to your sorcerer level.

sheet.description: When you take damage from a creature within 60 feet that you can see, you can use your reaction to spend 2 sorcery points and rebuke them with elemental flame. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{spellcasting:dc:cha}}), and on a failed save they take {{level:sorcerer}} fire damage. In addition, you no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep.

description.p: You are a stoneblood sorcerer, a mortal with an intrinsic tie to the elemental plane of earth. The stalwart power of stone suffuses your body making you immovable and unyielding as the mountains. Did you gain this power from an ancient earth elemental, barter for it with the greedy Dao, or are you descended from the original dwarves, molded from the bedrock of the world? The power that dwells within your blood urges you to remain steadfast in your decisions, and hoard the fruits of the earth; precious gems and alloys.

div.p: When using the Stoneblood Origin presented here, consider pairing them with a genasi character for a true elemental experience!

description.p: You learn certain spells at the sorcerer levels noted in the Stoneblood Magic table. They count as sorcerer spells for you, but don't count against your number of Spells Known.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a conjuration or evocation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

td.em: steel wind strike, wall of stone

description.p: You can draw upon the earthen magic within you harden your physical form for a limited time. Starting at 1st level, you can use a bonus action to take on an elemental form, your physical form becomes covered in rock and stone, and you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You gain temporary hit points equal to your sorcerer level.
If you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield, your armor class is equal to 13 + your Constitution modifier.
You use your Constitution modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes.
Your unarmed strikes deal 1d10 bludgeoning damage. If you strike with two free hands, the d10 becomes a d12.

description.p: This transformation lasts for one minute, until you end it as a bonus action, or fall unconscious. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
In addition, your connection to elemental earth allows you to speak, read, and write Terran. You can communicate with creatures that speak Primordial and it's other dialects.

sheet.description: You take on an elemental form for up to 1 minute. For the duration, you gain {{level:sorcerer}} temporary hit points. If you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield, your AC is {{heart-of-stone:ac}}. You use your Constitution modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d10 bludgeoning damage. If you strike with two free hands, the d10 becomes a d12. You can communicate with creatures that speak Primordial and it's other dialects.

description.p: You have learned to draw upon the crushing weight of the earth to augment your strikes. Starting at 6th level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can expend sorcery points to deal additional bludgeoning damage to the target. The extra damage is 2d6 for 2 sorcery points, plus 1d6 for each additional sorcery point you expend. This bludgeoning damage is considered magical for the sake of overcoming resistances and immunities.
The maximum number of sorcery points you can expend on this ability is equal to your proficiency bonus.
In addition, your unarmed strikes while in your elemental form from your Heart of Stone feature count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances and immunities.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can expend sorcery points to deal additional bludgeoning damage to the target. The extra damage is 2d6 for 2 sorcery points, plus 1d6 for each additional sorcery point you expend (up to {{proficiency}}). This bludgeoning damage is considered magical for the sake of overcoming resistances and immunities. In addition, your unarmed strikes while in your elemental form from your Heart of Stone feature count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances and immunities.

description.p: Your connection to the elemental magic of earth allows you to extend its mystical protection to you and your allies. Beginning at 14th level, you can use a bonus action to expend 3 sorcery points and grant an aegis of protective earth magic to one creature you touch, including possibly yourself. The creature gains resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute.

When a creature hits the protected target with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the attacker and make one melee weapon attack against them. You can teleport in this way only if you and the attacker are on the same surface.
If you use this ability to grant a protective aegis to another creature, the effect immediately ends for the first creature.

sheet.description: You can grant an aegis of protective earth magic to one creature you touch, including possibly yourself. The creature gains resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. When a creature hits the protected target with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the attacker and make one melee weapon attack against them. You can teleport in this way only if you and the attacker are on the same surface. If you use this ability to grant a protective aegis to another creature, the effect immediately ends for the first creature.

description.p: You have mastered the elemental earth that dwells deep within your soul, allowing you to become more elemental then mortal. Upon reaching 18th level, you no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep, and you are permanently resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
In addition, you can have your Aegis of Stone active on up to three creatures at one time.

sheet.description: You can have your Aegis of Stone active on up to three creatures at one time. You no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep.

description.p: Within you dwells a spark of elemental air, marking you as a stormsoul sorcerer. You have an innate affinity with the storms and squalls of the material world. How did you come to bear this power within you? Were you blessed at birth by a noble Djinni, did you make a deal with a primordial air elemental, or were you born in the eye of a terrible storm?

div.p: When using the Stormsoul Origin presented here, consider pairing them with a genasi character for a true elemental experience!

description.p: You learn certain spells at the sorcerer levels noted in the Stormsoul Magic table. They count as sorcerer spells for you, but don't count against your number of Spells Known.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a conjuration or evocation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

When you call upon your inner storm you gain the ability to fly, if only briefly. Starting at 1st-level, when you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher you gain a temporary flying speed equal to your remaining movement speed, that lasts until the end of your current turn. If you end your movement in the air you fall to the ground, taking appropriate falling damage. While flying you do not provoke opportunity attacks.
In addition, your connection to elemental air allows you to speak, read, and write Auran. You can communicate with creatures that speak Primordial and it's other dialects.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher you gain a temporary flying speed equal to your remaining movement speed, that lasts until the end of your current turn. If you end your movement in the air you fall to the ground, taking appropriate falling damage. While flying you do not provoke opportunity attacks. You can communicate with creatures that speak Primordial and it's other dialects.

description.p: Your control over the storm within you grows, empowering your physical form against tempestuous magic. Beginning at 6th-level you are resistant to lightning and thunder damage.

In addition, whenever you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, you can expend additional sorcery points to cause stormy magic to erupt from you. For each additional sorcery point you expend you can force one creature within 15 feet of you to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, targets take thunder damage equal to half your sorcerer level.

sheet.description: Whenever you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, you can expend additional sorcery points. For each additional sorcery point you expend you can force one creature within 15 feet of you to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{spellcasting:dc:cha}}) or take {{level:sorcerer:half}} thunder damage.

description.p: In addition to controlling the storm within, your affinity for the winds allows you to exert control over the weather around you. Starting at 6th-level, you can control existing weather conditions in the following ways:

ul.li: If it is raining, as an action, you can stop the rain from falling in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on you. You can end this effect as a bonus action on your turn.

If it is windy, as a bonus action, you can change the direction the wind blows within a 100-foot radius sphere centered on you. The wind blows in the direction you choose until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: You can control existing weather conditions. If it is raining, as an action, you can stop the rain from falling in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on you. You can end this effect as a bonus action on your turn. If it is windy, as a bonus action, you can change the direction the wind blows within a 100-foot radius sphere centered on you. The wind blows in the direction you choose until the end of your next turn.

description.p: Upon reaching 14th-level, your power over the wind allows you to fly. You gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed. As you fly your lower extremities become a whirlwind.

sheet.description: As you fly your lower extremities become a whirlwind.

description.p: You have mastered the elemental storm that rages within you, and you have become more elemental then mortal. Upon reaching 18th-level, you no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep, and you are immune to lightning and thunder damage.

In addition, when you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force the attacker to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes thunder damage equal to your sorcerer level and is pushed back 30 feet in a straight line. On a successful save they take half damage and do not move.

sheet.description: When you are hit by a melee attack, you can force the attacker to make a Strength saving throw (DC {{spellcasting:dc:cha}}). On a failed save, the creature takes {{level:sorcerer}} thunder damage and is pushed back 30 feet in a straight line. On a successful save they take half damage and do not move.

description.p: Within you dwells a drop of elemental power drawn from primordial waters. You have an innate connection to the ocean depths, babbling brooks, and the frigid waters of frozen lakes. How did you come to wield the power of elemental waters? Did you inexplicably survive a shipwreck, awakening with oceanic power, or did you drink from a stream flowing from the elemental plane of water?

div.p: When using the Wavebron Origin presented here, consider pairing them with a genasi character for a true elemental experience!

description.p: You learn certain spells at the sorcerer levels noted in the Waveborn Magic table. They count as sorcerer spells for you, but don't count against your number of Spells Known.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a conjuration or evocation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

The elemental waters within you have altered your physical form. Starting at 1st-level, you are resistant to cold damage, you gain a swimming speed equal to your movement speed, and you can breathe both air and water.
In addition, your connection to elemental water allows you to speak, read, and write Aquan. You can communicate with creatures that speak Primordial and it's other dialects.

sheet.description: You can breathe both air and water. You can communicate with creatures that speak Primordial and it's other dialects.

description.p: When you draw upon the oceanic energy within you, your watery spells carry with them a deadly curse. Starting at 1st-level, when you cast a spell that deals cold damage, reduces a creature's movement speed, or forces a creature to move, you can spend additional sorcery points to reduce the movement speed of the creature. For each sorcery point you expend, the movement speed of the creature is reduced by 5 feet.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell that deals cold damage, reduces a creature's movement speed, or forces a creature to move, you can spend additional sorcery points to reduce the movement speed of the creature. For each sorcery point you expend, the movement speed of the creature is reduced by 5 feet.

description.p: Beginning at 6th-level, you can assume a watery form when under assault. When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to shift into a liquid form, gaining resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the end of your current turn. As part of the same reaction you can immediately move up to your full movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you are hit by an attack, you can shift into a liquid form, gaining resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the end of your current turn. As part of the same reaction you can immediately move up to your full movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

description.p: Your improved control over the elemental waters that fuel your power improves your Curse of the Depths. Starting at 14th-level when you reduce the movement speed of a creature to 0 with your Curse of the Depths feature, you can force the creature to make an (additional) Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is covered in elemental ice and is restrained until the start of your next turn. A creature can use an action to scrape the ice off the target, ending the restrained condition early.
In addition, while you are using your swimming speed, you can take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.

sheet.description: When you reduce the movement speed of a creature to 0 with your Curse of the Depths feature, you can force the creature to make an (additional) Constitution saving throw (DC {{spellcasting:dc:cha}}). On a failed save, the creature is covered in elemental ice and is restrained until the start of your next turn. A creature can use an action to scrape the ice off the target, ending the restrained condition early. In addition, while you are using your swimming speed, you can take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.

description.p: Upon Reaching 18th level, your body and soul are permanently altered by the power of the primordial sea from which you draw your power. You no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep, you are immune to cold damage, and you are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
In addition, when you are hit with a critical hit, you can use your reaction to turn the critical hit into a normal hit.

sheet.description: You no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep. In addition, when you are hit with a critical hit, you can use your reaction to turn the critical hit into a normal hit.

description.p: Once a generation a true ruler is born among the people. Not necessarily of royal blood, these mortals have been marked by the gods for a great destiny. Some people seek out these rulers, trusting in divine judgment to select their ruler. However, to those currently in power, these sorcerers pose a great threat and are often secretly, and sometimes openly, persecuted by the powers that be.

As a Divine Right sorcerer, you are destined to rule over your kin. You have been granted great power, but with that power comes responsibility. Will you use your abilities to lead the your people to destruction or into a new golden age?
You learn certain spells at the sorcerer levels noted in the Royal Magic table. They count as sorcerer spells for you, but don't count against your number of Spells Known.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The spell must be a conjuration or enchantment spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

At 1st-level, when you are marked for royal greatness, you are blessed with the ability to rule. A Divine Mark appears somewhere one your body signifying the type of ruler you are destined to become. Select one of the Divine Marks detailed below. Once chosen, your Divine mark cannot be changed short of a wish spell or divine intervetion.

Mark of Elegance. Your rule will be marked by diplomacy and kind words. You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill, and you can add double your proficiency bonus to any Charisma (Persuasion) check you make.

Mark of Guile. Your rule will be marked by deception and ruthless cunning. You gain proficiency in the Deception skill, and you can add double your proficiency bonus to any Charisma (Deception) check you make.

Mark of Might. Your kingship will be marked by strength of arms and a willingnesss to fight. You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill, and you can add double your proficiency bonus to any Charisma (Intimidation) check you make.
Your rule will be marked by diplomacy and kind words. You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill, and you can add double your proficiency bonus to any Charisma (Persuasion) check you make.

sheet.description: You can add double your proficiency bonus to any Persuasion check you make.

description.p: Your rule will be marked by deception and ruthless cunning. You gain proficiency in the Deception skill, and you can add double your proficiency bonus to any Charisma (Deception) check you make.

sheet.description: You can add double your proficiency bonus to any Deception check you make.

description.p: Your kingship will be marked by strength of arms and a willingnesss to fight. You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill, and you can add double your proficiency bonus to any Charisma (Intimidation) check you make.

sheet.description: You can add double your proficiency bonus to any Intimidation check you make.

description.p: Your voice is imbued with power. Starting at 6th-level, when you target a friendly creature with a spell of 1st-level or higher they gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), in addition to the effects of the spell.
In addition, when you cast an enchantment targeting a creature within 5 feet that can both see and hear you, you can impose disadvantage on the creature's saving throw.
Once you force a creature to have disadvantage in this way you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When you cast an enchantment targeting a creature within 5 feet that can both see and hear you, you can impose disadvantage on the creature's saving throw. In addition, whenever you target a friendly creature with a spell of 1st-level or higher they gain {{cha-mod:min-one}} temporary hit points.

description.p: Your very presence inspires confidence in your allies. Starting at 14th-level, you can use your reaction to alter the course of battle. When a friendly creature within 60 feet, that can see you, is forced to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to give them advantage on the roll.

sheet.description: When a friendly creature within 60 feet, that can see you, is forced to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to give them advantage on the roll.

description.p: Upon reaching 18th-level you have become a legendary figure of authority for your people and your god has blessed you with increased divine power. You can cast divine word without expending a spell slot. Once you use this feature you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 7th-level or higher.

sheet.description: You can cast divine word without expending a spell slot. Once you use this feature you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 7th-level or higher.

description.p: Every so often, a mortal catches the attention of a powerful lord or lady of the Fey. Often the object of affection or the offspring of this relationship is gifted arcane power beyond that of most mortal beings. However, these infatuations are often short-lived, and the mortals are left to learn to use their power with little supervision or instruction. Weather you were born of such a relationship, grew up near a Crossroads, or were chosen by a powerful Fey creature, you have been blessed with the changing and chaotic power of the Feywild.

Your link to the feywild grants you an affinity with charms and enchantments. When you learn a sorcerer cantrip or spell, you can choose the new spell from the bard or the sorcerer spell list. You must obey all other restrictions for selecting the spell, and it becomes a sorcerer spell for you.
You learn certain spells at the sorcerer levels noted in the Fey Magic table. They count as sorcerer spells for you, but don't count against your number of Spells Known.
Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be from the bard spell list.

Starting at 1st level, your magic gives you heightened empathic abilities. As an action you can touch a creature and force them to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you learn the creatures alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw. Creatures are not aware that you attempted to read their heart.

div.p: If your table does not use Alignment, then in place of this ability your sorcerer gains proficiency in the Insight skill and can add double their proficiency bonus to any Wisdom (Insight) check they make to read the state of a creature's heart or intentions.

sheet.description: You can touch a creature and force them to make a Charisma saving throw (DC {{spellcasting:dc:cha}}). On a failed save, you learn the creatures alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw. Creatures are not aware that you attempted to read their heart.

description.p: Beginning at 6th-level, you gain the ability to align your soul with one of the four seasons, much like the denizens of the Feywild. At the end of a long rest, you align yourself with one of the four seasons below, gaining the benefits from the Seasonal Attunement table. Each season grants you a damage resistance and advantage on certain rolls.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, you align yourself with one of the four seasons, gaining the benefits from the Seasonal Attunement table

description.p: You learn to briefly slip between the feywild and the material plane. Starting at 14th-level, immediately after casting a spell of 1st-level or higher, can choose to teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet that you can see.
When you use this ability you can choose to expend sorcery points to teleport further then 30 feet. For each sorcery point you expend you can teleport an additional 10 feet.

sheet.description: Immediately after casting a spell of 1st-level or higher, can choose to teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet that you can see. When you use this ability you can choose to expend sorcery points to teleport further then 30 feet. For each sorcery point you expend you can teleport an additional 10 feet.

description.p: Upon reaching 18th-level, you emanate an aura of intoxicating charm in a 15-foot radius. Friendly creatures within the aura are immune to the charmed condition. In addition, when you cast an enchantment spell of 1st-level or higher that targets a creature within your aura, they have disadvantage on the saving throw.

sheet.description: You emanate an aura of intoxicating charm in a 15-foot radius. Friendly creatures within the aura are immune to the charmed condition. In addition, when you cast an enchantment spell of 1st-level or higher that targets a creature within your aura, they have disadvantage on the saving throw.

description.p: In order to master their power, mystics must first master themselves. Spending years in quiet contemplation, they explore their minds leaving nothing uncovered. When a mystic finally masters their power, they can use their mind to coerce their body into performing impressive physical feats. Though their training is secretive, mystics who become adventurers aren't content to remain hidden for long.
You learn certain spells at the sorcerer levels noted in the Mystic Magic table. They count as sorcerer spells for you, but don't count against your number of Spells Known.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The spell must be a divination or transmutation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

Starting at 1st-level, you learn how to unlock the hidden potential within your body. You gain proficiency in either Acrobatics, Athletics, Perception, Sleight of hand, or Stealth. At the end of a long rest, you can switch the proficiency you gained from this feature with another from the above list.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in either Acrobatics, Athletics, Perception, Sleight of hand, or Stealth. At the end of a long rest, you can switch the proficiency you gained from this feature with another from the above list.

description.p: Beginning at 6th-level, you can channel psionic power into your body, honing your reflexes and agility to an incredible degree. You can spend 2 sorcery points to take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn. When you use the Dash action in this way, you can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

sheet.description: You can spend 2 sorcery points to take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn. When you use the Dash action in this way, you can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

description.p: Starting at 14th-level, you can use your psionic abilities to become ethereal and move through solid objects. As a bonus action, you can enter a semi-corporeal state. Any other equipment you are wearing or carrying transforms with you and becomes ethereal as well. While in this state you are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks. You can also move through solid objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn inside an object or return to your normal form while inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, and you take 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet you traveled.
This feature lasts for 1 minute, until you use a bonus action to end it, or you are incapacitated. Once you use this feature you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You can enter a semi-corporeal state for up to 1 minute. Any other equipment you are wearing or carrying transforms with you and becomes ethereal as well. While in this state you are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks. You can also move through solid objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn inside an object or return to your normal form while inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, and you take 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet you traveled.

description.p: Upon reaching 18th-level, your body is completely suffused with psionic power. You no longer age, and you are immune to disease, poison damage, and the poisoned condition.

If you die, roll a d20. On a roll of 10 or higher, instead of dying, you discorporate with 0 hit points, and fall unconscious. Your body disappears, and anything you are carrying falls to the ground. You appear at a spot of your choice on the plane of existence where you died, 1d4 days later, having gained the benefits of a long rest.

div.p: For the mechanics to match the fantasy of a psionic character, replace all Charisma-based features with Intelligence: including saving throw proficiencies, spellcasting ability, multiclassing prerequisites, and any class or subclass features.

sheet.description: You no longer age, and you are immune to disease, poison damage, and the poisoned condition. If you die, roll a d20. On a roll of 10 or higher, instead of dying, you discorporate with 0 hit points, and fall unconscious. Your body disappears, and anything you are carrying falls to the ground. You appear at a spot of your choice on the plane of existence where you died, 1d4 days later, having gained the benefits of a long rest.

description.p: One day a light blazed forth within you, the illumination of psionic power. Your mind now simmers with this power, the full extent of which you won’t fully grasp for years to come. You can touch other minds and alter the world around you, controling the magical energy of the multiverse.
Will this power shine from you as a hopeful beacon to others? Or will you be a source of terror to those who witness the strange manifestations of your might?
You learn certain spells at the sorcerer levels noted in the Psionic Magic table. They count as sorcerer spells for you, but don't count against your number of Spells Known.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The spell must be a divination or transmutation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

At 1st-level, you begin to unlock your mind's potential. Choose one of the cantrips to learn from the list below. It doesn't count against your number of Cantrips Known. Its casting time becomes 1 bonus action, it requires no verbal or somatic components, and it gains the modification below. You learn 1 additional cantrip from this list at 6th and 10th-level.

description.p: Upon reaching 18th-level, you can spend 6 sorcery points as a bonus action to transform yourself into pure psionic energy. In this form, you have resistance to all damage except force and psychic damage, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.

If you end your turn inside an object or return to your normal form while inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, and you take 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet you were forced to travel.
You remain in this form for 1 minute. It ends early if you are incapacitated, or end it as a bonus action.

description.p: At 1st level, a sorcerer gains the Sorcerous Origin feature. The following options are available to a sorcerer, in addition to those offered in the Player’s Handbook: The Genasi Bloodlines: Emberheart, Stoneblood, Stormsoul, and Waveborn, and the bloodline of Dwarven royalty, the Runebrand.

Once a generation the heads of the seven dwarven clans gather to select a new king. This process is lengthy and often takes years to reach a decision, but when the new king is selected he undergoes a secret ceremony, imbuing his soul with the divine blessing of rulership.

As a Runebrand sorcerer, you are destined to rule over dwarvenkind. You have been granted great power, but with that power comes responsibility. Will you live up to expectations and look to lead the dwarves into a new golden age?

When you are chosen to lead, you undergo the ancient dwarven ritual of kingship. At the end of this ritual a Divine Rune appears upon your brow signifying the type of ruler you have chosen become. At 1st level, select one of the Divine Runes below. It will be the source of your sorcerous power, and cannot be changed short of a wish spell or direct intervention from a deity.

Rune of Elegance. Your kingship will be marked by diplomacy and level headed judgment. You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill, if you have proficiency already you gain expertise, which means you add double your proficiency bonus to Persuasion checks.

Rune of Guile. Your kingship will be marked by cunning words and utilitarian politics. You gain proficiency in the Deception skill, if you have proficiency already you gain expertise, which means you add double your proficiency bonus to Deception checks.

Rune of Might. Your kingship will be marked by conquest and strength of arms. You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill, if you have proficiency already you gain expertise, which means you add double your proficiency bonus to Intimidation checks.

The spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These spells can’t be replaced when you gain a level in this class.

Your voice is imbued with power. Starting at 1st level, when you target a friendly creature with a spell of 1st-level or higher they gain (additional) temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier, in addition to the effects of the spell.

Additionally, you can cast command as a 1st-level spell, without expending any sorcery points. You can do this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 6th level your presence exudes confidence and nobility. As an action on your turn you can expend 3 sorcery points and speak a royal word of power, it’s effects determined by your Divine Rune.

Rune of Elegance. You utter a word of power that uplifts your allies. A number of friendly creatures equal to your Charisma modifier, within 30 ft., have advantage on their next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw before the beginning of your next turn.

Rune of Guile. You utter a word of power that confounds your foes. A number of enemy creatures equal to your Charisma modifier, within 30 ft., must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure they are charmed by you, and will do anything in their power to please you, until the beginning of your next turn.

Rune of Might. You utter a word of power that causes your enemies to quake with fear. A number of enemy creatures equal to your Charisma modifier, within 30 ft., must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure they are frightened of you, and will do anything in their power to avoid fighting you, until the beginning of your next turn.

description.p: An alien influence has wrapped its tendrils around you, warping you in both body and mind. Perhaps a psychic splinter lodged in your psyche after you suffered domination by an aboleth. Maybe you were born somewhere tainted by the Far Realm, a planar blot that changed you forever. Or perhaps mind flayers kidnapped you, subjecting you to the nightmarish process of ceremorphosis — but the transformation failed and left you altered.

div.p: Psionics hold a unique spot in Dungeons & Dragons and is a critical part of one of the most iconic monsters; the Illithid. However, there has never been a satifying option for playing a fully-fledged psionic character in 5th edition.

With some adjustments, I believe the sorcerer class is the best way to bring this type of player character to life. To have the flavor fully match the mechanics of a psionic character, talk to your Dungeon Master about using the following optional rules (or use my Alternate Sorcerer).

ul.li:
Intelligence Spellcasting:
Change your saving throw proficiency, Spellcasting ability, Multiclassing prerequisites, and any other mentions of Charisma in the Sorcerer class description with Intelligence.

Psionic Origin Spells:
One of the main drawbacks of the sorcerer is the small amount of spells known. Adding a list of Origin Spells, flavorful &thematic spells that you automatically learn at certain levels, can go a long way to enhancing your psionic character.

Psionic Sorcery:
At 6th level, you gain the optional feature, Psionic Sorcery which lets you cast spells without V,S,M components.

Spell Point Casting Variant:
Use the Variant: Spell Points rule from page 288 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide. Spell points allow for more flexibility for the caster, and better simulate psionic mental resources. Just make sure to limit the number of spells of 6th-level and higher you can cast per day.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Aberrant Magic table. The spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These can’t be replaced when you gain a sorcerer level.

Starting at 1st level, your aberrant origin protects you from harm. Your body might have a coating of viscous slime, tough hide, scales, or an invisible psionic barrier (choose the form of protection when you gain this feature). Whatever form the protection takes, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier while you aren’t wearing armor.
Additionally, the aberrant influence causes your hit point maximum increase by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

sheet.description: When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals {{ac:aberrant resilience}}.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, when you cast a spell from your Aberrant Magic spell list, you can choose to cast it without any verbal, somatic, or material components.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. You regain all uses of this ability when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell from your Aberrant Magic spell list, you can choose to cast it without any verbal, somatic, or material components.

description.p: At 6th level, you gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, you can unleash the aberrant truth hidden within your flesh. As a bonus action, you can spend 2 or more sorcery points to transform your body for 1 hour. For each 2 sorcery points you spend, you can gain one of the following benefits of your choice, the effects of which last until the transformation ends:

ul.li: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and the ability to breathe water. Gills grow from your neck and your fingers become webbed.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. As you fly, your skin glistens with mucus.

Your body, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, becomes slimy and pliable. You can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing, and you can spend 5 ft. of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.
Your eyes turn black or become writhing sensory tendrils. You are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 60 ft. of you.

sheet.description: You can spend 2 or more sorcery points to transform your body for 1 hour. For each 2 sorcery points you spend, you can gain one of the listed benefits (your choice).

description.p: At 18th level, you become the focal point of a reality-warping anomaly. As an action, you can magically radiate a transparent, 20 ft. radius aura for 1 minute. Creatures of your choice treat the aura as difficult terrain, and when they start their turn in it, they take 2d10 psychic damage.

As a bonus action, you can end the aura early. If you do so, you and any number of creatures you choose within the aura are teleported to a location that you are familiar with, up to 1 mile away. Each creature must appear within 20 ft. of you and in an unoccupied space. Unwilling creatures must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure they are teleported.
Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

description.p: You protect your mind with a wall of looping, repetitive thought. Until the start of your next turn, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and you have resistance to psychic damage.

description.p: You drive a disorienting spike of psychic energy into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 psychic damage, and the first time it makes a saving throw before the end of your next turn, it must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the save.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach certain levels: 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You propel a lance of psionic disruption into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 3d6 psychic damage, and it can use its action only to Dash or Disengage on its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and this spell doesn’t limit its action options.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

You unleash a destructive wave of mental power in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 5d8 force damage, is pushed 20 feet directly away from you, and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn’t pushed or knocked prone.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.
